column4: How can I save all the passwords for websites, social networking sites, messenger programs, etc, in one place/password wallet & have a single ubuntu/gnome system password too put in thats EASIER/LESS SECURE than the ones i use online, so that I may use a LONG & different password for all my online activities/different websites, and only remmember one password & have the username/password for THAT specific site stored/recalled & entered for me? IS gnom
e-keyring the solution too this? or w/e its called?
why is keyring not installed by default in karmic?
i shouldent have too tell you to do this
im not trying too be condescending, nor was i being--i dont appreciate you saying that too me its kind of rude
and i don't see what right you have too insult me? furthermore
Sorry mMezquitale: you are correct. I was feeding the troll
is gnome keyring installed with karmic koala by default?
I can not find it anywhere
Speculator: if that option exists in compiz I have not seen it yet.

'wallet manager'?.  I think theres an application that might fit this in Applications>Accessories.  I don't have a GUI system in front of me to check the exact name though. I think it may have been called Encryption and Password.
As FCalderon said: Passwords and encryption keys
Pici:FCalderon: This is nothing like the gnome-keyring & wallet manager in ubuntu 9.04, nor does this look associated at all with gnome-keyring?
Are you perhaps thinking of kwalletmanager ? Thats a KDE application and is not installed by default with Ubuntu.
perhaps, but there was a very similiar app in gnome too
